required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of Lu AG06474 in Healthy Young Men
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional, Randomized, Double-Blind, Sequential-Group, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Ascending Oral Dose Study Investigating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Properties of Lu AG06474 and Open-Label, Cross-Over Study to Investigate Intra-Subject Variability and the Effect of Food in Healthy Young Men

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and tolerability of Lu AG06474 and what the body does to Lu AG06474 after swallowing single doses of the drug.

detailed_description.textblock: Part A: randomized, double-blind, sequential. Part B: randomized, open-label, cross-over.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Part A: randomized, double-blind, sequential. Part B: randomized, open-label, cross-over.

primary_outcome.measure: Parts A and B: Number of participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
Part A: Electrocardiogram (ECG) Parameter (Delta QTcF) at 24 Hours on Day 1
Part A: Change From Pre-Dose Baseline in ECG Parameter (Delta QTcF) at 24 Hours on Day 1
Part A: Bond-Lader VAS Dimension Scores at Day 4
Part A: Change From Pre-Dose Baseline in the Bond-Lader VAS Dimension Scores at Day 4
Part A: Percentage of Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMC)-Mediated Hydrolysis of 2-arachidonolylglycerol (2-AG) Ex Vivo (% of Pre-Dose Measurement of Arachidonic Acid [AA])
Parts A and B: AUC0-inf of Lu AG06474
primary_outcome.description: Area under the Lu AG06474 concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUC0-inf)

primary_outcome.measure: Parts A and B: Cmax of Lu AG06474
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration for Lu AG06474

primary_outcome.measure: Parts A and B: Tmax of Lu AG06474
primary_outcome.description: Nominal time corresponding to the occurrence of Cmax of Lu AG06474

primary_outcome.measure: Part A: t1/2 of Lu AG06474
primary_outcome.description: Apparent elimination half-life of Lu AG06474

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part A: Single Dose of Lu AG06474 or Placebo
arm_group.description: Participants will receive single oral dose of Lu AG06474 or placebo.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part B: Repeated Dose of Lu AG06474 and Food Interaction
arm_group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of Lu AG06474 in each dosing period (Period 1, 2, and 3) in the following sequence: Sequence B1: Fed - Fasting- Fasting Sequence B2: Fasting- Fed - Fasting Sequence B3: Fasting- Fasting - Fed

intervention.arm_group_label: Part A: Single Dose of Lu AG06474 or Placebo
Part B: Repeated Dose of Lu AG06474 and Food Interaction
Part A: Single Dose of Lu AG06474 or Placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The participant has a body mass index (BMI) ≥18.5 and ≤30 kilograms (kg)/square meter (m^2) at the Screening Visit and at the Safety Baseline/Baseline Visit.
- The participant is, in the opinion of the investigator, generally healthy based on medical history, a physical examination, vital signs, a safety ECG, and the results of the clinical chemistry, haematology, urinalysis, serology, and other laboratory tests.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The participant has taken disallowed medication <1 week prior to the first dose of study drug or <5 half-lives prior to the Screening Visit for any medication taken.
- The participant has orthostatic hypotension, defined as a decrease in systolic blood pressure ≥20 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) and/or a decrease in diastolic blood pressure ≥10 mmHg from supine to standing, at the Screening Visit or at the Safety Baseline/Baseline Visit.
- The participant has a QTcF interval >450 milliseconds (ms) at the Screening Visit or at the Safety Baseline/Baseline Visit, as calculated by the ECG equipment and evaluated by the investigator.
- The participant has taken any investigational medicinal product <3 months prior to the first dose of study drug.
- The participant has received an injection of COVID-19 vaccination less than 30 days prior to the first dose of study drug.
Other inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.
